intro: Mamillopsis diguetii, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers and milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Mamillopsis diguetii is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, such as parts of southern California and Baja California.
